text: GitHub doesn't talk IPv6 and i am stuck on an IPv6 only machine. Ideas welcome. So no `]add Dependency`  for me.

text:
Gitlab has IP v6.
I wonder if you could use the gitlab mirror of all packages

 <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-unofficialjuliamirror-mirror-of-all-registered-julia-packages/15983|https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-unofficialjuliamirror-mirror-of-all-registered-julia-packages/15983>

attachments.title: [ANN] UnofficialJuliaMirror: Mirror of all registered Julia packages
attachments.text: Since JuliaPackageMirrors is no longer maintained, I have set up a new mirror of Julia packages at <https://github.com/UnofficialJuliaMirror>. Currently, only packages that are registered in the General registry are mirrored. If you maintain your own registry of Julia packages that you would like mirrored, or if you have an unregistered package that you would like mirrored, please open an issue at <https://github.com/UnofficialJuliaMirror/MirrorUpdater.jl/issues>. The mirror is automatically updat...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: [ANN] UnofficialJuliaMirror: Mirror of all registered Julia packages

elements.text:
Gitlab has IP v6.
I wonder if you could use the gitlab mirror of all packages

text:
I wonder if we could add IPv6 support to the Pkg servers? <@U66GD0880> <@U6795JH6H> 

If we can add IPv6 support to the Pkg servers, and if all the packages (and artifacts) you need are available on the Pkg servers, then there won't be any need for you to connect to GitHub.

elements.text: I wonder if we could add IPv6 support to the Pkg servers?
If we can add IPv6 support to the Pkg servers, and if all the packages (and artifacts) you need are available on the Pkg servers, then there won't be any need for you to connect to GitHub.

text: Just FYI, the UnofficialJuliaMirrors are no longer maintained, and are very out of date

elements.text: Just FYI, the UnofficialJuliaMirrors are no longer maintained, and are very out of date

text: Until we have IPv6 support on the Pkg servers, one option is to build a Docker image with the packages you want on a computer with IPv4, and then transfer that Docker image to the IPv6 computer.

elements.text: Until we have IPv6 support on the Pkg servers, one option is to build a Docker image with the packages you want on a computer with IPv4, and then transfer that Docker image to the IPv6 computer.

text: I think we generally just need to add AAAA records. I’ll take a look tomorrow.

elements.text: I think we generally just need to add AAAA records. I’ll take a look tomorrow.
